an8.70:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
an8.70:4.2: Then the Buddha got dressed in the morning and, taking his bowl and robes, entered Vesālī for alms.
an8.70:4.3: Then, after the meal, when he had returned from alms-round, he addressed Venerable Ānanda:
an8.70:4.5: Let’s go to the Cāpāla tree shrine for the day’s meditation.
an8.70:4.6: “Yes, sir,” replied Ānanda. Taking his sitting cloth he followed behind the Buddha.
an8.70:5.1: Then the Buddha went up to the Cāpāla shrine,
an8.70:5.2: where he sat on the indicated seat.
an8.70:5.3: When he was seated he said to Venerable Ānanda:
an8.70:6.1: “Ānanda, Vesālī is lovely. And the Udena, Gotamaka, Sattamba, and Bahuputta, Sārandada, and Cāpāla tree shrines are all lovely.
an8.70:6.3: Whoever has developed and practiced the four bases for psychic power—made them a vehicle and a basis, kept them up, consolidated them, and properly implemented them—may, if they wish, live on for the eon or what’s left of the eon.
an8.70:6.4: The Realized One has developed and practiced the four bases for psychic power, made them a vehicle and a basis, kept them up, consolidated them, and properly implemented them.
an8.70:6.5: If he wished, the Realized One could live on for the eon or what’s left of the eon.”
an8.70:6.6: But Ānanda didn’t get it, even though the Buddha dropped such an obvious hint, such a clear sign.
an8.70:6.8: “Sir, may the Blessed One please remain for the eon! May the Holy One please remain for the eon! That would be for the welfare and happiness of many people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.” For his mind was possessed by Māra.
an8.70:7.2: And for a third time, the Buddha said to him:
an8.70:7.3: “Ānanda, Vesālī is lovely. And the Udena, Gotamaka, Sattamba, and Bahuputta, Sārandada, and Cāpāla tree shrines are all lovely.
an8.70:7.4: Whoever has developed and practiced the four bases for psychic power—made them a vehicle and a basis, kept them up, consolidated them, and properly implemented them—may, if they wish, live on for the eon or what’s left of the eon.
an8.70:7.5: The Realized One has developed and practiced the four bases for psychic power, made them a vehicle and a basis, kept them up, consolidated them, and properly implemented them.
an8.70:7.6: If he wished, the Realized One could live on for the eon or what’s left of the eon.”
an8.70:7.7: But Ānanda didn’t get it, even though the Buddha dropped such an obvious hint, such a clear sign.
an8.70:7.9: “Sir, may the Blessed One please remain for the eon! May the Holy One please remain for the eon! That would be for the welfare and happiness of many people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.” For his mind was possessed by Māra.
an8.70:8.1: Then the Buddha said to Venerable Ānanda:
an8.70:8.3: “Yes, sir,” replied Ānanda. He rose from his seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before sitting at the root of a tree close by.
an8.70:8.4: And then, not long after Ānanda had left, Māra the Wicked said to the Buddha:
an8.70:9.1: “Sir, may the Blessed One now become finally extinguished! May the Holy One now become finally extinguished!
an8.70:9.2: Now is the time for the Buddha to become finally extinguished.
an8.70:9.3: Sir, you once made this statement:
an8.70:9.4: ‘Wicked One, I will not become fully extinguished until I have monk disciples who are competent, educated, assured, learned, have memorized the teachings, and practice in line with the teachings; not until they practice appropriately, living in line with the teaching; not until they’ve learned their teacher’s doctrine, and explain, teach, advocate, establish, open, analyze, and make it clear; not until they can legitimately and completely refute the doctrines of others that come up, and teach with a demonstrable basis.’
an8.70:9.5: Today you do have such monk disciples.
an8.70:10.1: May the Blessed One now become finally extinguished! May the Holy One now become finally extinguished!
an8.70:10.2: Now is the time for the Buddha to become finally extinguished.
an8.70:10.3: Sir, you once made this statement:
an8.70:10.4: ‘Wicked One, I will not become fully extinguished until I have nun disciples who are competent, educated, assured, learned …’ …
an8.70:10.5: ‘Wicked One, I will not become fully extinguished until I have layman disciples who are competent, educated, assured, learned …’ …
an8.70:10.6: ‘Wicked One, I will not become fully extinguished until I have laywoman disciples who are competent, educated, assured, learned …’ …
an8.70:10.7: Today you do have such laywoman disciples.
an8.70:11.1: Sir, may the Blessed One now become finally extinguished! May the Holy One become finally extinguished!
an8.70:11.2: Now is the time for the Buddha to become finally extinguished.
an8.70:11.3: Sir, you once made this statement:
an8.70:11.4: ‘Wicked One, I will not become fully extinguished until my spiritual life is successful and prosperous, extensive, popular, widespread, and well proclaimed among gods and humans.’
an8.70:11.5: Today your spiritual life is successful and prosperous, extensive, popular, widespread, and well proclaimed among gods and humans.
an8.70:12.1: Sir, may the Blessed One now become finally extinguished! May the Holy One become finally extinguished!
an8.70:12.2: Now is the time for the Buddha to become finally extinguished.”
an8.70:12.4: The final extinguishment of the Realized One will be soon.
an8.70:12.5: Three months from now the Realized One will finally be extinguished.”
an8.70:13.1: So at the Cāpāla tree shrine the Buddha, mindful and aware, gave up the life force.
an8.70:13.2: When he did so there was a great earthquake, awe-inspiring and hair-raising, and the thunder cracked the sky.
an8.70:13.3: Then, knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha uttered this aphorism:
an8.70:14.1: “Comparing the incomparable with an extension of life,
an8.70:14.2: the sage gave up the life force.
an8.70:14.4: he broke his extended existence like a suit of armor.”
an8.70:15.3: That was really a very big earthquake; awe-inspiring and hair-raising, and the thunder cracked the sky!
an8.70:15.4: What’s the cause, what’s the reason for a great earthquake?”
an8.70:16.1: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha,
an8.70:16.2: bowed, sat down to one side,
an8.70:16.4: “Sir, that was a really big earthquake!
an8.70:16.5: That was really a very big earthquake; awe-inspiring and hair-raising, and the thunder cracked the sky!
an8.70:16.6: What’s the cause, what’s the reason for a great earthquake?”
an8.70:17.1: “Ānanda, there are eight causes and reasons for a great earthquake.
an8.70:17.3: This great earth is grounded on water,
an8.70:17.4: the water is grounded on air,
an8.70:17.5: and the air stands in space.
an8.70:17.6: At a time when a great wind blows,
an8.70:17.8: and the water stirs the earth.
an8.70:17.9: This is the first cause and reason for a great earthquake.
an8.70:18.1: Furthermore, there is an ascetic or brahmin with psychic powers who has achieved mastery of the mind, or a god who is mighty and powerful.
an8.70:18.2: They’ve developed a limited perception of earth and a limitless perception of water.
an8.70:18.3: They make the earth shake and rock and tremble.
an8.70:18.4: This is the second cause and reason for a great earthquake.
an8.70:19.1: Furthermore, when the being intent on awakening passes away from the group of Joyful Gods, he’s conceived in his mother’s belly, mindful and aware. Then the earth shakes and rocks and trembles.
an8.70:19.2: This is the third cause and reason for a great earthquake.
an8.70:20.1: Furthermore, the being intent on awakening comes out of his mother’s belly mindful and aware. Then the earth shakes and rocks and trembles.
an8.70:20.2: This is the fourth cause and reason for a great earthquake.
an8.70:21.1: Furthermore, the Realized One realizes the supreme perfect awakening. Then the earth shakes and rocks and trembles.
an8.70:21.2: This is the fifth cause and reason for a great earthquake.
an8.70:22.1: Furthermore, the Realized One rolls forth the supreme Wheel of Dharma. Then the earth shakes and rocks and trembles.
an8.70:22.2: This is the sixth cause and reason for a great earthquake.
an8.70:23.1: Furthermore, the Realized One, mindful and aware, gives up the life force. Then the earth shakes and rocks and trembles.
an8.70:23.2: This is the seventh cause and reason for a great earthquake.
an8.70:24.1: Furthermore, the Realized One becomes extinguished through the natural principle of extinguishment without anything left over. Then the earth shakes and rocks and trembles.
an8.70:24.2: This is the eighth cause and reason for a great earthquake.
an8.70:24.3: These are the eight causes and reasons for a great earthquake.”
